maml:description.maml:para: Adds or updates an alert rule of either metric, event, or webtest type
Adds or updates an alert rule of either metric, event, or webtest type. The added rule is associated to a resource group and has a name.
The relational operator for the condition of the rule.
The threshold of the rule.
The uri of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The metric (name) the rule is monitoring. This is only used in metric-based rules.
The aggregation operator to apply to the time window when the rule is being evaluated.
The type of the rule: Metric, Event, Webtest
The location where the rule is to be defined.
The description of the rule.
If present disables the rule. If absent the rule is enabled.
The resource group (name) of the rule
Name of the rule
The time window size for the rule to compute its data.
If present instructs the rule to send a notification to the service owners when the rule fires.
A comma-separated list of e-mail addresses to use when notifying customers about a the rule firing.
The relational operator for the condition of the rule.
The threshold of the rule.
The uri of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The name of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The source of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The level of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The operation name
The resource provider
The status
The substatus
The e-mail address to use when reporting rule activation.
The type of the rule: Metric, Event, Webtest
The location where the rule is to be defined.
The description of the rule.
If present disables the rule. If absent the rule is enabled.
The resource group (name) of the rule
Name of the rule
The time window size for the rule to compute its data.
If present instructs the rule to send a notification to the service owners when the rule fires.
A comma-separated list of e-mail addresses to use when notifying customers about a the rule firing.
The failed location count for the webtest rules. This is similar to the threshold in the other types of rules.
The type of the rule: Metric, Event, Webtest
The location where the rule is to be defined.
The description of the rule.
If present disables the rule. If absent the rule is enabled.
The resource group (name) of the rule
Name of the rule
The time window size for the rule to compute its data.
If present instructs the rule to send a notification to the service owners when the rule fires.
A comma-separated list of e-mail addresses to use when notifying customers about a the rule firing.
The relational operator for the condition of the rule.
The threshold of the rule.
The uri of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The metric (name) the rule is monitoring. This is only used in metric-based rules.
The aggregation operator to apply to the time window when the rule is being evaluated.
The type of the rule: Metric, Event, Webtest
The location where the rule is to be defined.
The description of the rule.
If present disables the rule. If absent the rule is enabled.
The resource group (name) of the rule
Name of the rule
The time window size for the rule to compute its data.
If present instructs the rule to send a notification to the service owners when the rule fires.
A comma-separated list of e-mail addresses to use when notifying customers about a the rule firing.
The name of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The source of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The level of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The operation name
The resource provider
The status
The substatus
The e-mail address to use when reporting rule activation.
The failed location count for the webtest rules. This is similar to the threshold in the other types of rules.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: AddAlertRule (Metric) --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: add-alertrule -RuleType Metric -Name chiricutin -Location "East US" -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -Operator GreaterThan -Threshold 2 -WindowSize 00:05:00 -ResourceUri /subscriptions/a93fb07c-6c93-40be-bf3b-4f0deba10f4b/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/misitiooeltuyo -MetricName Requests -Description "Pura Vida" -TimeAggre Total

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a metric alert rule attached to a website
RequestId StatusCode --------- ---------- 33574ccf-0b01-43b4-aa97-87e6bbcf1c11 Created

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: AddAlertRule disabling a rule --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: add-alertrule -RuleType Metric -Name chiricutin5 -Location "East US" -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -Operator GreaterThan -Threshold 2 -WindowSize 00:05:00 -ResourceUri /subscriptions/a93fb07c-6c93-40be-bf3b-4f0deba10f4b/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/misitiooeltuyo -MetricName Requests -TimeAggre Total -CustomE gu@macrosoft.com -send -disab

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables a rule. If the rule does not exist, it creates it disabled. If the rule exists, then it just disables it.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: AddAlertRule (Metric) with some actions --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: add-alertrule -Name chiricutin5 -Location "East US" -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -Operator GreaterThan -Threshold 1 -ResourceUri /subscriptions/a93fb07c-6c93-40be-bf3b-4f0deba10f4b/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/misitiooeltuyo -MetricName Requests -TimeAggre Total -CustomE gu@macrosoft.com,h@dd.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a metric alert rule attached to a website and with some e-mails to send notifications to.
RequestId StatusCode --------- ---------- 9a5bc388-c7ac-4dc6-aa70-f4bc29c2c712 OK

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the history of alerts.
Retrieves the history of alerts as they get enabled, disabled, fire, resolve, etc.
The resource uri the rule is associated to.
Specifies the start time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current local time minus one hour.
Specifies the end time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current time.
Specifies a filter by status. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
Specifies a filter by caller. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)
The resource uri the rule is associated to.
Specifies the start time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current local time minus one hour.
Specifies the end time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current time.
Specifies a filter by status. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
Specifies a filter by caller. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)

maml:description.maml:para: Gets alert rules
Gets alert rules either from a ResourceGroup or a particular alert rule if its name or Uri is known.
The name of the resource group.
The Uri of the target resource
If present, it enables the display of full details in the output.
The name of the resource group.
The name of the alert rule
If present, it enables the display of full details in the output.
The name of the resource group.
The Uri of the target resource
If present, it enables the display of full details in the output.
The name of the alert rule

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: get alertrules for a ResourceGroup, no details --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all the alert rules for a ResourceGroup. The output does not contain details about the rules.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: get a single alert rule identified by name, no details --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a single alert rule identified by name and resource group name. The output contains only basic information about the alert rule.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Gets a particular rule identified by name and provides details about it --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a particular rule identified by name and resource group name. The output provides details about the rule.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the operations associated with a CorrelationId
Gets the operations associated with a CorrelationId.
Specifies a filter by correlationId. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the start time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is EndTime minus one hour.
Specifies the end time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current time. The value must be earlier than StartTime, but not more than 15 days.
Specifies a filter by status. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
Specifies a filter by caller. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)
In-memory profile (AzureProfile).
Specifies a filter by correlationId. This parameter is mandatory.
Specifies the start time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is EndTime minus one hour.
Specifies the end time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current time. The value must be earlier than StartTime, but not more than 15 days.
Specifies a filter by status. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
Specifies a filter by caller. This parameter is optional. The fault is an empty string (i.e. no filter)
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)
In-memory profile (AzureProfile).

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the operations associated to the given CorrelationId that took place in the last hour.
This command lists all the operations associated to the given CorrelationId that took place on or after 2015-01-01T10:30 local time.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: GetAzureCorrelationIdLog with start and end times --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the operations associated to the given CorrelationId that took place on or after 2015-01-01T10:30 local time, but before 2015-01-01T11:30 local time.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the operations associated to the user's subscriptionId (see Add-AzureAccount for details) that took place in the last hour.
This command lists all the operations associated to the user's subscriptionId (see Add-AzureAccount for details) that took place on or after 2015-01-01T10:30 local time.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the operations associated to the user's subscriptionId (see Add-AzureAccount for details) that took place on or after 2015-01-01T10:30 local time, but before 2015-01-01T11:30 local time.
